page.title: 19WILD ANIMALS AROUND CLATFORD
page.content: The {ECOLOGY}of this area is rich in animals{ }in the {CLATFORD,WHERWELL region of Hampshire.There is diversity of {HABITAT}river and semi marsh land,deciduous forest and farmland with hedgerows.Around the river and marshland there are water voles,coots,moorhens,swans,ducks, kingfishers and even a heron.In Harewood Forest there are many game birds and shooting is a popular sport.Also in the forest there are many small mammals and also roe deer which can be seen on the roads and fields near the woodland.They are the smallest deer in Britain.Despite many hedges disappearing as farmers search for more land,many hedgerows and conservation areas exist in this region,so rabbits,hares,mice,voles, stoats and weasels are plentiful.
